title: Conic Sections: Circles, Parabolas, and Ellipses

vocab.definition: Curve formed by intersecting a cone with a plane
Set of points equidistant from a center point
Set of points equidistant from a focus and directrix
Set of points where sum of distances to two foci is constant
Fixed point used as reference for conic sections

teachingNotes: Use geometric definitions and algebraic equations. Connect to real-world applications like satellite dishes and planetary orbits.
